question: Conditional statements in Python allow a program to make ________ based on conditions.
The if statement executes a block of code only if a given condition is ________.
The syntax of an if statement starts with the keyword ________.
If the condition in an if statement is False, the code inside the if block is ________.
The if…else statement provides an ________ in case the condition is False.
In an if…else statement, if the condition is False, the code inside the ________ block executes.
The if…elif…else statement is used when we have ________ conditions to check.
The elif statement is short for ________.
If none of the conditions in an if…elif…else statement are True, the ________ block executes.
A nested if statement is an if statement placed ________ another if statement.
Nested if statements help in checking ________ conditions inside another condition.
The if condition is followed by a ________ before the block of code.
Indentation is important in Python because it defines the ________ of the statements.
In Python, an if statement can check for conditions using ________ operators.
The real-life example of an if…else statement is checking a person's ________ for voting eligibility.
The condition in an if statement must return a ________ value.
A number is checked for being even or odd using the ________ operator.
The if statement allows a program to execute a code block only when the condition is ________.
An if…elif…else statement is useful for handling ________ possibilities.
The following syntax is incorrect: if condition then:
The output of `if 5 > 3: print('Yes')` is ________.
The else block is ________ if the if condition is True.
Python's indentation rule ensures that the code is structured in a ________ way.
An if statement without an else block will execute if the condition is ________.
The elif keyword in Python is used to check ________ conditions.
